page.title: 20POPULATION AND HOLIDAYS
page.content: in during afternoon playtime to finish it. At 20 past 3 I clear away. When I get home after school I have a bacon sandwich and my friend, Jolanda comes on the 4.30 bus. We walk round the village and play on the swings for a bit. It's cold. Jolanda goes back home. I have supper and watch TV for a long time. Then I go to bed for a good nights sleep! {POPULATION}_ of 67 children in school, 40 were born in Millhouse 27 else_ where (in South Yorkshire). One family was from Bury in Lancashire, one from London, one from Kent. In the past year only three families have left the area. The population is fairly static. {HOLIDAYS }_ A survey of children in school showed that nearly everyone had a holiday, 20 families went abroad, 54 in Britain, Scotland was the most pop_ ular place in Britain, Greece abroad.
